name: Hotel Caravaggio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007
reviews.text: Booked this hotel through their web site after many recommendations online and it did not disappoint. The street in front is busy and noisy so getting a back room is essential and worth every penny. We had an incredible view from our room of the Duomo and a lovely courtyard. The room was simply appointed, extremely clean, with a good bathroom (with towel warmer), an excellent breakfast buffet in the morning, and an overall first rate, helpful and friendly staff.
reviews.title: A Room With A View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a 3 block walk from the train station so it’s convenient (though the street has narrow sidewalks and is swamped at rush hour), but it’s close to everything (Michelangelo’s “David” being only a few blocks away). There are a ton of places to eat nearby (from cheap to posh), pharmacies, a supermarket, etc. For the money, this 3 star gem was just wonderful and is highly recommended.
reviews.title: Convenient

likes.liked: — It was close to right places

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was just what we were looking for, the staff were very friendly and they all spoke in English. Th breakfast was good, the maids did their job well, and it was very close (10mins walk away) from the train station (SMN) and 5 mins away from the Duomo. I went there with my boyfriend and although the atmosphere isn't romantic it was still very nice. it was well priced too. I was there over New Years Eve and the price literally doubled on the 31st and 1st for accomodation but that's to be expected everywhere. i would definitely recommend this hotel, and although the road it's in isn't exactly pretty there's a supermarket down the road and a square with trees and a merry - go - round right opposite, so when you're looking for it remember it's opposite Piazza Independenza.
reviews.title: Hail to the Jacuzzi!!!

likes.disliked: — Forence has narrow streets...made for walking single file

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you read JM Scotland's review, I met him while I was there. Leonardo and company do a great job of providing information.
reviews.title: Well worth considering

likes.liked: — Clean, good size bedroom with excellent bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was fine, and I would agree that a room in the back was probably a better choice regarding noise. Also, we had a great view of the Duomo, as it is lit up at nite. If booking at this hotel, and you are going to be walking a lot during the day, I highly recommend choosing a room that has a jacuzzi tub. I used it every nite, and it made all the difference getting me ready for the next walking day!
reviews.title: Very good value hotel

likes.disliked: — Not all rooms had good views or quiet locations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just come back from a long weekend at the Caravaggio. It far exceeded our expectations! It was exceptionally clean and tastefully furnished. YOu could tell that it was recently refurbished. It was 10 minutes walk from main train station, and around the corner from the big central market, and restaurants. Staff very friendly and helpful - we were given a map on our arrival and shown the main tourist places to visit. Breakfast was very good by continental standards - fresh croissants instead of pre-packed ones! The only gripe was the noisy traffic outside - but not a fault of the hotel!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Caravaggio!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What a great little hotel - only 5 mins walk from the station and not much further to the Duomo.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights over the bank holiday weekend and walked everywhere - it's such an easy location. The hotel is nicely decorated and furnished, we had a large triple room (for 2 of us) on the front of the hotel overlooking the park. Nice room & bathroom but it was pretty noisy from the road - even with the windows closed.
reviews.title: Comfortable and close to sights

likes.liked: — Central location, walking distance to sights, shopping, restaurants, train

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel are great - especially Giuseppe who laughed at us rolling home at 3am every morning! We only managed to make it to breakfast twice, but it is in a lovely light room with a good selection of cereals, croissants etc (no hot food).
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Value, Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Florence is a wonderful place and the people are some of the friendliest I have ever met. We felt like locals by the time we left, and walking through San Lorenzo Market everyday, all the stall holders greeted us like old friends!
reviews.title: great staff and good location

likes.liked: — friendly staff, clean, excellent breakfast, convenient location slightly away from tourist frenzy
likes.disliked: — everything was good but not for those who want to hang about the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location near the train station and within 5-10 minutes walk to the Mercato Centrale and the Duomo. The rooms are small but clean. However, it is noisy.
reviews.title: Clean, good location --but noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you are at all sensitive to noise, then it is very important that you get a room in the back of the hotel. We stayed in the front and the traffic and other street noise was very loud. I had earplugs and it was still difficult to sleep (I have spent hundreds of nights in hotel rooms around the world for business and leisure travel so I do have some good comparisons).
reviews.title: Fantastic little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I asked to change rooms (or even hotels) and the staff were not very sympathetic saying that it is a 'city hotel' and that they would charge me a cancelation fee if I moved hotels (48 hour cancelation policy).
reviews.title: Nice, Quiet Hotel, within walking distance to activities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: Had a wonderful 2 nights in Hotel Caravaggio. This has to be one of the best small hotels I have ever encountered in a European city. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Breakfast was lovely. Our room was spotless. Location was great - 5 min walk from train station, 10 minutes from shops and sights. What a bargain - highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although this hotel can be a bit hard to find.. (we highly recommend taking your GPS).. it is a great little hotel. The rooms were very clean, the beds were comfortable.. it has very good air conditioning. The bathrooms are a good size and very clean.
reviews.title: Good clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the Hotel Caravaggio in September 2008, it was a very hot weekend, the Hotel was cool though because all the rooms are air conditioned, we had a room at the back of the hotel which was quiet, although this meant that there were no views, we overlooked a middle area of the hotel onto another window! This was fine though as we were out all day every day and only returned to change and shower for the evening, the bed was large and comfortable and the bathroom was large with a good shower, the breakfast was really good, lots of selection, buffet continental, eggs, rolls, jam, ham, cheeses, coffee and tea, fresh juice... and v.nice staff, it was a good set up for the day ahead. Florence is a beautiful city, with so much to do, and see, I was unaware that you could pre-book on line tickets for the main sights, if I had known this I would have pre-booked a few i.e Michelangelo's David, there was a long queue. Be warned though it is an expensive place we paid 12 euro for 2 ice creams! We had a wonderful time in Florence, then on the last day we went on the train to Pisa, which again I recommend an amazing sight, you have to book to go up the tower as they only allow about 30 a time, so it can be quite a wait for your turn, pisa also has a nice town with lots of shops and restaurants/cafes. also v. pretty.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Hotel Caravaggio was a gem. I have stayed at many European 3-star hotels and this was by far the best.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Caravaggio

likes.liked: — The cleanliness and close proximity to everything in Florence
likes.disliked: — They charge 1 Euro for 15 minute Internet access!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quiet, and I had a view of the Duomo (Room 302). The staff was very friendly and more than accommodating. The room was extremely large by European standards as well as the bathroom. I even had a jacuzzi. The hotel room and bathroom were very, very clean. Decorations were modest but not tacky.
reviews.title: Basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The TV was not that old when you see what actual Italians have in their homes. If you want a 42" LCD Plasma, go to a five-star hotel in Florence, and pay $600 or more per night. This hotel was very well priced. I stayed for six nights for less that $1,000.00.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Caravaggio

likes.liked: — The cleanliness and close proximity to everything in Florence
likes.disliked: — They charge 1 Euro for 15 minute Internet access!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: As for the mini fridge not working, mine was not working at first, and the staff said they would gladly store anything for me. Additionally, they do not rip you off on the drinks and snacks inside the mini-fridge.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Too Bad Florence is Overrun With Toursits/Students

likes.liked: — Spaciousness of the room and breakfast offering

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for my honeymoon. I was so pleased with the room. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean and a good size. The staff was friendly and helpful. I highly recommend. This was the best hotel stay my entire trip.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights for a city break. We found the hotel well-maintained, clean, comfortable and the staff were exceptionally friendly. Marco on reception was a great help in recommending places to visit and very knowledgeable on Italian history and art.
reviews.title: Great place for a short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was good - easy and safe walk to the main sights and plenty choice of eating places nearby. We found some good deals for dinner in the trattorias around the market area.
reviews.title: Cute hotel very close to Accademia

likes.disliked: — Oltrano is a bit of a walk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely little garden area at the back of the hotel which became our peaceful haven for a drink after a busy day sight-seeing. Breakfast room light and airy and we always found plenty supplies of the continental breakfast - bakery seemed fresh every day.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only slight negative experience was the noise from the piazza on the front of the hotel - we were unlucky in not being able to secure a garden-facing room but hey it didn't spoil our enjoyment and we would come back to this hotel again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - great for a short break

likes.disliked: — The road leading up to it. Whilst njot bad, it wasn't very picturesque.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great little hotel not very far from train station. Comfortable room, though shower was a bit small. Excellent location for walking around exploring. Very helpful staff, particularly when trying to get museum reservations. Would suggest getting a room at the back of the hotel; ours was at the front and had some traffic noise at night, but not too bad. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent location to discover Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was at least ten minutes walk from the train station. The room I had was large and facing the backyard, so it was really quiet. Bathroom was large and clean also. Breakfast was just average. Staff was very helpful. All the major attractions were within walking distance. There was a self-service Laundromat on the same street next block. Very convenience when you were on a long trip.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Not very near the train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husban and I spent 4 nights at the Caravaggio. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the train station. Like most european cities, the immediate areas around train stations are colourful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Slightly iffy location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't feel unsafe but by no means do you feel central to all the attractions etc.
reviews.title: Little Gem - great location

likes.disliked: — Could only use the lift to get up to our room

reviews.title: A smashing little hotel - would recommend!
reviews.text: The hotel itself was great! We asked for a room facing the back and this is key... the street noise at the front was fairly high and if you are a light sleeper like me... do yourself a favour. OUr views were beautiful, we'd wake up looking at the duomo. It was a 15-20 min walk to central florence. Right around the corner from St. Lorenzo's market. Be sure to buy leather here.... it is well priced, if you pick your leather well and don't forget to BARGAIN.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had two rooms, the first was on the street side "Nationale Street". If you like sirens, motor scooter engines, and loud drunks all night across the street in the park, then you will enjoy this room. Even with the window closed, it was very loud.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second room was on the backside of the hotel and we paid extra for a "view". What a joke, the view was of old Florence apartments with hanging dirty laundry and dumpsters. To see the Duomo, you would have to lean way out of the window and strain your neck.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are small boxes and allow no sitting area except sitting on your bed. The breakfast is mostly prepackaged items from the dollar grocery store down the street.
reviews.title: Not bad but really noisy if you are on the street side of th hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the location is within walking distance of the hotel ONLY if you have no bags. The street sidewalk is very narrow and you will not enjoy stepping into the street to walk with your luggage. If you get a cab, know this :CAB DRIVERS IN FLORENCE ARE THIEVES".
reviews.title: Unbeatable Location and Value, Loved It!

likes.liked: — Location and all around quality and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have rented taxi's throughout Europe with no problem however if this hotel calls a cab for you, the meter starts at the time the hotel calls. It could take 10 minutes for the cab to arrive and you paid for it. The drivers also claim to not speak english which is absolutely incorrect. I suggest that you agree to a price BEFORE stepping into the cab. I wish someone had told me this info.
reviews.title: Great location and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Caravaggio two weeks ago and loved it. I had requested a room towards the back instead of facing the street so it would be a little quieter. One was waiting for us when we checked in, exactly how I requested. It was very peaceful and I spent several hours just looking out of the window each day. We had wonderful weather so the breeze was nice. If you stuck your head out of the window you could see the Duomo! We were right over the little enclosed patio area in the back. It was small, but very pretty with wrought-iron benches and tables. Our last afternoon we spent chatting with a fellow American and enjoying gelato out on the patio.
reviews.title: Great customer service!!

likes.liked: — the wonderful staff made all the difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The sitting areas were very clean and nice. There was internet access on the computer there for 1E per 15min. They had a bar for drinks near reception but we didn’t use it. The breakfast was wonderful and the staff kept it well stocked. We found all of the front desk staff to be exceptional. They not only accommodated our every request but anticipated some of our needs.
reviews.title: You Won't Go Wrong Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The elevator is small and the only way up and down floors, but nothing terrible. The rooms were average sized for Europe and the shower small, but it was fine for two of us. I think the double bed was actually a double and not two twins pushed together. It was very comfortable. We loved seeing the entrance of the hotel after a long day of walking and always had a cheerful hello and goodbye. They even remembered what room we were in so we never had to ask for the key upon return, they always had the right one ready to hand us.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The way to the hotel was a bit tricky as there was construction on some of the roads leading from the train station. It might be best to take a cab to and from the train station if you have several pieces of luggage. We spent over 30 min trying to find the hotel once we reached the piazza, asking pedestrians and police for help without success. Coming from the train station it is on the right with a small awning over the doorway. It should be easy to find if you stay on the right side of the road!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Very Good Value For Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For me, it is extremely rare to rate a hotel as "Excellent." So, my rating of "above average should not imply any significant negatives. This is a very good hotel. Hotel Caravaggio is NOT fancy. It is simply a good, clean, generally quiet hotel that is well-located and a very good value. The best feature is the excellent, English-speaking front desk assistants. They are superior. The majority of the people staying at the hotel were Americans and I heard no complaints from any of them. Bear in mind that this is a three star hotel but the front desk service is genuinely helpful without "attitude." We had a "superior" room that was not large but certainly large enough. The bathroom was small and the bath tub very small but everything was spotless. Our room was on the front of the building so we got some street noise, especially early in the morning. A room that does not face the street would probably have been better. However, we managed very well and enjoyed our stay of three nights. The breakfast is typical for an Italian three star hotel. Our only suggestion for improvement would be to have a "real" queen-size bed instead of two single beds pushed together. Bottom line: we will stay here whenever we are in Florence.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great price

description: 500 meters from the central train station of Florence and very close to the Polo Fieristico Fortezza da Basso, Palazzo dei Congressi, Stazione Leopolda, where the main displays and fairs take place.
